title: BBC Scotland channel prompts 'insult' to Wales claim
text:
BBC Scotland channel prompts 'insult' to Wales claim 22 February 2017 Image copyright Getty Images Image caption BBC Scotland will get its own TV channel - BBC Wales will not The BBC has been accused of insulting Wales after it announced a new TV channel for Scotland. 
The £30m Scottish channel , which will have a nightly 21:00 news show, has prompted criticism from Welsh politicians. 
The announcement was made a day after the BBC said it was investing an extra £8.5m a year in Welsh TV programmes - short of the £30m demanded by politicians. 
The BBC has been asked to comment. 
Tory AM Darran Millar tweeted that the Scottish announcement made the funding for Wales look like an "insult", while Labour shadow culture minister Kevin Brennan said it seemed that BBC Wales was "being short-changed compared to Scotland". 
A spokesman for the National Union of Journalists said: "Wales is being treated disgracefully, as there are no apparent plans for a similar channel or investment here. 
"Whilst we are delighted that the BBC is investing in journalism jobs in Scotland, yesterday's announcement of extra money for Wales pales when compared with what's being offered and Welsh licence-fee payers are being short-changed. 
"We call on BBC Cymru Wales to revisit the package announced yesterday and return with more imaginative and far-reaching proposals, similar to the ones being planned for Scotland." Related Topics
